name: Ext_R5_Medication_in_strength
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.Medication.ingredient.strength[x] for use in FHIR R4B
description: This cross-version extension represents Medication.ingredient.strength[x] from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Medication|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4B.

element.definition: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication.  For example, 250 mg per tablet.  This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.
element.comment: `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` maps to R4B `Medication.ingredient.strength`. Type `CodeableConcept` has no mapping Type `Quantity` has no mapping So is mapped as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget.

This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.

binding.description: A coded concpet defining the strength of an ingredient.
